intro: Hieracium socophyes, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring sunny to partially shaded environments. Its yellow flowers are composed of numerous small florets, and it produces achenes as its seed type. Hieracium socophyes is often considered a weed in agricultural settings due to its rapid spread and ability to thrive in various conditions.
